author: Alejandro V

text: While I never grew up with PSO I had the Dreamcast theme for 3DS. I bought it around late 2016 so Hearing this theme reminds me of that time between then and the Switch coming out where I still used the thing almost daily. It's interesting how much nostalgia this theme invokes even on the 3DS.
author: MG

text:
One of this game's most interesting moves was being re-released on Gamecube and Xbox.

I wonder how many people would have missed it if it wasn't released to GC and XBox as well.
I never even had a Dreamcast and had a blast playing this on the GC.

Purely offline tho. Until i played the game on PC on a private server - i really felt stupid how good the game
actually was online with its full potential, it already was an amazing blast offline. 
we used to always meet up and play together bringing our memory cards

text: @nie ooi well there's Phantasy Star Online 2 for pc and now there's a fanmade english Patch for the game, since SEGA promised but NEVER released this game outside of Japan. coming soon for vital theres going to be: Phantasy Star NOVA, you can also play, Phantasy star Portable 1 and 2 for the PSP, Phantasy Star Zero for DS,  Phantasy Star Universe (ps2, ps3, 360) and Phantasy Star Universe: Ambition of the Illuminus, you can choose one and play it. If you wanna play PSO, theres plenty of people playing on the Schthack Private Sever, there are a community and people playing the dreamcast, gamecube and pc editions

text: Oh Gods, how I miss playing this game with my bros.  This was an awesome game.  Tried playing PSO2, but the hour long patchings (which were constant) and the language barrier (even with the translation patches) proved too high a hurdle to overcome.  I can only hope that they bring this game over here.  Until then, I might have to play this one on a private server.

text: I have some of the greatest memories with this game. Such a fun game on xbox until hackers and glitch exploits ruined the game with all the over-powered weapons and mags. Not only that but they also duplicated everything so trading was pointless and meseta. I'm playing PSO 2 (JP) and I wish it would get released Internationally. Would also be great on PS4 since that platform is already running F2P games like DCUO.
author: Amiiix

text: PSO2 is coming to XB1 and PC in Spring 2020! It's also coming to PS4 and Switch, but there's no word on when that'll be.
author: kavenoff777

text: Nostalgia has been triggered. Can't believe this game is 14 years old, I still remember playing it as if it was yesterday. I wasn't even aware that Phantasy Star Online 2 released in Japan last year. The series' sci-fi setting is very well realised and refreshing, and Kobayashi's music is always solid. This is the game that propelled his composing career.
author: SupraDarky

text: Thanks for this song, i still play the game online in my Wii, and I have the full OST is incredible, i play the full soundtrack when I have to work all night long in my computer. My favorite songs from PSO are (every track for this game, but this I love the most): Can still see the light, Jungle (A lush load), Leaving flow, Silent palace (Premium Edition). :)
author: Kevin Mejia

text: It's weird how a song you have no memory can reappear at the first playing of a few notes, fully formed again like you've never forgotten it.  I heard this song on loop a billion times, but until now, it might as well have been entirely erased from my brain.
